column4: How can I find out which device (i.e. tty0) my USB stick is plugged into/
what ? I work on wired network now on the same laptop with wireless
wired is working, wireless has drivers but apparently doesn't work
under wireless networks when i click the icon in my toolbar it just says 'disconnected-as nick said...I have the same issue...
what kind of wireless card do you have?
broadcom bcm4312...tried the link on ubuntu website...the guide did not helped
when you finish if you have any suggestions I'm listening.
your problem is that you need to get your broadcom card to work. I don't know what to tell you on that one. Did it work before? Or is this just a wireless card you are trying to get to work?
yes, it was not working there neither...

that's strange. The only thing I could think of is that your wireless drivers got upgraded and the new ones are not working for your card. For example my atheros card used to use the madwifi drivers, but now in 9.10 and on they use teh ath5k and in 10.04 the ath9k driver.
